abilities.name: Indestructible
abilities.mechanics_description: Mordekaiser's Indestructible is a **self-cast ability** that grants him a shield based on a percentage of his maximum health, making it primarily **defensive**. It also heals him for a portion of the damage he has recently dealt.
abilities.original_description:
Mordekaiser stores damage he deals and takes to create a shield. He may consume the shield to heal. Passive: Mordekaiser stores {{ damageconversion*100 }}% of the damage he deals and {{ damagetakenconversion*100 }}% of the damage he takes.

Active: Mordekaiser gains the stored damage as Shield. He may Recast this Ability to restore {{ healingpercent*100 }}% of the remaining Shield as Health.

Minimum Shield: {{ minhealthtooltip }}
Maximum Shield: {{ maxhealthtooltip }}

abilities.name: Obliterate
abilities.mechanics_description: Mordekaiser's Obliterate (Q) is a **cone-shaped skillshot** that deals damage and knocks up enemies hit by its **third cast**. It's used offensively to deal damage and set up crowd control, especially potent when Mordekaiser is near an enemy to maximize damage on all three pulses.
abilities.original_description: Mordekaiser smashes the ground with his mace dealing damage to each enemy struck. Damage is increased when hitting a single enemy. Mordekaiser smashes the ground with Nightfall dealing <magicDamage>{{ qdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>, increased to <magicDamage>{{ empowereddamagetooltip }}</magicDamage> if it hits only a single enemy.

abilities.name: Death's Grasp
abilities.mechanics_description: Death's Grasp is a skillshot that Mordekaiser launches in a target direction. Enemies hit are pulled towards Mordekaiser and take damage, and he gains a shield if he hits at least one champion.
abilities.original_description:
Mordekaiser pulls all enemies in an area. Passive: Mordekaiser gains {{ magicpen*100 }}% Magic Penetration.

Active: Mordekaiser pulls enemies in his direction, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Realm of Death
abilities.mechanics_description: Mordekaiser's **Realm of Death (R)** is a point-and-click ability that targets an enemy champion, instantly pulling them into the Death Realm with Mordekaiser. Inside the realm, both Mordekaiser and his target duel, with Mordekaiser gaining increased stats and health regeneration while dealing heavy damage, aiming to defeat his opponent.
abilities.original_description:
Mordekaiser drags his victim to a different dimension with him and steals a portion of their stats. If he kills them, he keeps the stats until the victim respawns. Mordekaiser banishes a champion to the Death Realm with him for {{ spiritrealmduration }}s, stealing {{ statstealpercentscalar*100 }}% of their core stats for the duration.

If Mordekaiser kills that enemy in the Death Realm he consumes their soul, keeping the stats he stole until the target respawns.

abilities.name: Sonic Wave / Resonating Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Sonic Wave is a linear skillshot that damages the first enemy hit and reveals them. Resonating Strike is a dash that targets the revealed enemy, damaging them and allowing Lee Sin to move to their location. This ability is primarily used offensively for engaging, closing distance, and dealing damage, with the second cast providing gap-closing utility.
abilities.original_description:
Sonic Wave: Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound to locate his enemies, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it encounters. If Sonic Wave hits, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike for the next 3 seconds.
Resonating Strike: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by Sonic Wave, dealing physical damage based on the target's missing Health. Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound, dealing {{ initialdamage }} physical damage to the first enemy hit, granting True Sight of them, and allows Lee Sin to Recast for the next {{ reactivatetime }} seconds.

Recast: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by the sound wave, dealing between {{ recastdamage }} to {{ empowereddamage }} physical damage scaling with the target's missing Health.

abilities.name: Flurry
abilities.mechanics_description: **Flurry (Passive):** Lee Sin's basic attacks and abilities apply Flurry stacks. After hitting a target with an ability, his next two basic attacks within 3 seconds gain bonus attack speed. This passive is primarily used offensively, buffing Lee Sin's sustained damage output and allowing for faster ability rotations.
abilities.original_description: After Lee Sin uses an ability, his next 2 basic attacks gain Attack Speed and return Energy.

abilities.name: Safeguard / Iron Will
abilities.mechanics_description: Safeguard is a **dash** that can be cast on an allied unit (champion, minion, ward) or Lee Sin himself, granting Lee Sin a **shield** for a short duration. Upon reaching the target, Lee Sin gains **increased movement and attack speed**. Iron Will is a **toggle** that drains energy over time to grant Lee Sin bonus damage on his next three basic attacks.
abilities.original_description:
Safeguard: Lee Sin rushes to target ally, shielding himself from damage. If the ally is a champion, they are also shielded. After using Safeguard, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will.
Iron Will: Lee Sin's intense training allows him to thrive in battle. Lee Sin gains Life Steal and Spell Vamp. Lee Sin dashes to an ally or ward. If the target is a champion, Lee Sin grants them and himself {{ shieldamount }} Shield for {{ shieldduration }} seconds and reduces this Ability's Cooldown by {{ w1cooldownrecovered*100 }}%. Lee Sin may Recast for the next {{ w1reactivatetime }} seconds.

Recast: Lee Sin gains {{ lifestealandspellvamp }}% Life Steal and Spell Vamp for {{ lifestealandspellvamptime }} seconds.

abilities.name: Dragon's Rage
abilities.mechanics_description: Dragon's Rage is a point-and-click ability that allows Lee Sin to dash a short distance before launching a powerful kick, dealing damage and knocking back the target champion. This ability is primarily used offensively to deal significant burst damage and disrupt enemy positioning, often combined with his other abilities for aggressive plays.
abilities.original_description:
Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick launching his target back, dealing physical damage to the target and any enemies they collide with. Enemies the target collides with are knocked into the air for a short duration. This technique was taught to him by Jesse Perring, although Lee Sin does not kick players off the map. Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick Knocking Back an enemy champion and dealing {{ damage }} physical damage.

Enemies the target collides with are briefly Knocked Up and take {{ damage }} plus {{ percenthpcarrythrough }}% of the kicked enemy's bonus Health as physical damage.

abilities.name: Tempest / Cripple
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Tempest (First Cast):** **Skillshot** that Lee Sin *quakes his staff*, dealing physical damage in a **cone** in front of him and applying a debuff to enemies.

**Cripple (Second Cast):** If Tempest hits an enemy champion, Lee Sin can cast Cripple within a short window, dealing a small amount of magic damage and **slowing** them. This ability is primarily used offensively for damage and to set up further engages or escapes with the movement speed reduction.
abilities.original_description:
Tempest: Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage and reveals enemy units hit. If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast cripple.
Cripple: Lee Sin cripples nearby enemies damaged by Tempest, reducing their Move Speed. Move Speed recovers gradually over the duration. Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals {{ initialdamage }} magic damage and reveals them for {{ slowduration }} seconds. If this hits an enemy, Lee Sin can Recast for the next {{ reactivatetime }} seconds.

Recast: Lee Sin Slows nearby enemies struck by the shockwave by {{ slowamount }}% decaying over {{ slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Spirit Abjuration
abilities.mechanics_description: Aurora's passive, Spirit Abjuration, is an auto-target ability that triggers when she takes damage from enemy champions within a certain range. It grants her a burst of movement speed and a shield, allowing for an offensive repositioning to retaliate or a defensive escape.
abilities.original_description: Aurora's spells and attacks exorcise spirits from the enemies she damages. Exorcised spirits follow Aurora around and heal her.

abilities.name: Twofold Hex
abilities.mechanics_description: Aurora's "Twofold Hex" is a linear skillshot that deals damage and applies a debuff to the first enemy hit. This debuff allows her next basic attack or ability against the affected target to consume the debuff, dealing bonus damage and potentially triggering additional effects.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora sends out a missile that curses any enemies it hits. She can then recast the ability to draw active curses back toward herself, damaging foes who are hit along the way. Fire cursed energy in a direction, dealing {{ damage }} magic damage to enemies and cursing them for {{ markduration }} seconds.

Recast: End the curse, drawing back part of the enemy's spirit to Aurora, dealing up to {{ q2damagemax }} magic damage to enemies passed through based on their missing Health. Damage beyond the first hit is reduced to 20%.

If the duration runs out, Aurora will automatically Recast the Ability.

abilities.name: Across the Veil
abilities.mechanics_description: Across the Veil is a skillshot that Aurora throws in a target direction. If it hits an enemy champion, Aurora can reactivate the ability to dash a short distance to them, dealing damage and applying a slow.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora leaps in a direction of her choosing, entering the spirit realm upon landing, becoming invisible, and gaining Move Speed for a short duration of time. Hop in a direction. Upon landing, enter the spirit realm, becoming Invisible for {{ invisduration }} seconds and entering Realm Hopper, gaining {{ movespeedbonus }}% Move Speed.

Scoring a takedown on an enemy champion resets this Ability's Cooldown.

abilities.name: The Weirding
abilities.mechanics_description: Aurora's "The Weirding" (E) is a targeted skillshot that travels in a straight line, dealing magic damage and briefly slowing enemies hit. This ability is primarily used offensively to poke, trade, and set up further engagements, with the slow providing a valuable tool for sticking to targets or escaping.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora converges the realms, sending out a blast of spirit magic that damages and slows enemies before Aurora hops backward to safety. Converge the realms, sending out a blast of spirit magic dealing {{ damagecalc }} magic damage to enemies in the area and Slowing them by {{ slowpercent*-100 }}% decaying over {{ slowduration }} second.

Aurora hops backwards a short distance after casting.

abilities.name: Between Worlds
abilities.mechanics_description: Aurora's "Between Worlds" (R) is a targeted ability that, when cast on an enemy champion, instantly teleports her to them and deals damage. It's primarily an offensive engage tool used to close gaps and initiate fights, also providing a brief untargetable moment upon arrival.
abilities.original_description:
Aurora leaps in a direction of her choosing, releasing a shockwave that damages and slows any enemies it hits. Afterward, she creates an area that slows enemies within it and allows Aurora to teleport from one side of the area to the other. Leap in a direction. Upon landing, Aurora converges the realms, sending out a pulse of spirit energy that deals {{ damagecalc }} magic damage and Slows enemies hit by {{ slowpercent*-100 }}% for 2 seconds.

The area of convergence stays active for {{ areaduration }} seconds, granting Aurora Realm Hopper for {{ rbuffduration }} seconds, allowing her to jump from one edge of the area to another.

Enemies attempting to enter or leave the area are Slowed by {{ exitslowpercent*-100 }}% for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

Aurora can Recast this Ability to end the effect early.

abilities.name: Baleful Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Baleful Strike is a linear skillshot that Veigar fires in a target direction. It deals magic damage to the first enemy hit, and if it hits an enemy champion, Veigar gains permanent ability power.
abilities.original_description:
Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy that deals magic damage to the first two enemies hit. Units killed by this bolt grant Veigar some ability power permanently. Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to the first two enemies hit.

If Veigar kills an enemy with this Ability, he gains {{ spell.veigarpassive:dqkillstacks }} stack of Phenomenal Evil. Large minions and large monsters grant {{ spell.veigarpassive:dqkillstackslarge }} stacks instead.

abilities.name: Phenomenal Evil Power
abilities.mechanics_description: Veigar's passive, Phenomenal Evil Power, does not have a targeting mechanism as it is an inherent bonus that passively grants him Ability Power whenever he kills a unit or hits an enemy champion with an ability. This AP is gained both from last-hitting minions/monsters and from his other damaging abilities.
abilities.original_description: Veigar is the greatest Evil to ever strike at the hearts of Runeterra - and he's only getting bigger! Striking an enemy Champion with a spell or scoring a takedown grants Veigar permanently increased Ability Power.

abilities.name: Dark Matter
abilities.mechanics_description: Dark Matter is a targeted dark matter spell that Veigar casts on a chosen area, dealing magic damage to enemies within the radius. It is primarily used offensively to deal burst damage and clear waves, but its CC component can also be used defensively to deter enemies.
abilities.original_description:
Veigar calls a great mass of dark matter to fall from the sky to the target location, dealing magic damage when it lands. Stacks of Phenomenal Evil reduce Dark Matter's cooldown. Veigar summons dark matter from the sky, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

Every {{ spell.veigarpassive:pstacksperdarkmattercdr }} stacks of Phenomenal Evil reduce this Ability's Cooldown by {{ spell.veigarpassive:darkmattercdrincrement*100 }}%.

abilities.name: Event Horizon
abilities.mechanics_description: Event Horizon is a circular skillshot that, after a short delay, creates a cage of Dark Matter at the target location. This cage is used defensively or to trap enemies, applying a stun to anyone who moves through its walls.
abilities.original_description: Veigar twists the edges of space, creating a cage that Stuns enemies that pass through. Veigar twists the edges of space, creating a cage that <status>Stuns</status> enemies that pass through for {{ e1 }} seconds. The cage lasts for 3 seconds.

abilities.name: Primordial Burst
abilities.mechanics_description: Primordial Burst is a **skillshot** that Veigar casts in a target direction, erupting in a large, circular area after a short delay for a significant amount of damage. It is primarily used **offensively** to deal massive burst damage to one or more enemies, especially if they are low on health.
abilities.original_description: Blasts target enemy champion, dealing a large amount of magic damage, increasing based on the target's missing health. Veigar blasts an enemy champion with primal magic to deal between <magicDamage>{{ mindamage }} and {{ maxdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>, increasing with the target's missing Health. Damage is maximized against enemies below 33% Health.

abilities.name: Battle Fury
abilities.mechanics_description: Battle Fury is a passive ability for Tryndamere. It automatically grants him increased critical strike chance based on his Fury, which is generated by attacking and taking damage. This passive is used offensively to amplify Tryndamere's auto-attack damage and critical strike potential.
abilities.original_description: Tryndamere gains Fury for each attack, critical strike, and killing blow he makes. Fury passively increases his Critical Strike Chance and can be consumed with his Bloodlust spell.

abilities.name: Mocking Shout
abilities.mechanics_description: Mocking Shout is an **auto-target** ability that Tryndamere uses **defensively** to reduce incoming damage and **offensively** to debuff enemies within an area, lowering their attack damage. It is an activated ability with a cooldown, not a passive effect.
abilities.original_description: Tryndamere lets out an insulting cry, decreasing surrounding champions' Attack Damage. Enemies with their backs turned to Tryndamere also have their Move Speed reduced. Tryndamere hurls insults, reducing champions' Attack Damage by {{ adreduction*-1 }} for {{ reductionduration }} seconds. Enemy champions with their backs towards Tryndamere are <status>Slowed</status> by {{ slowpotency*-100 }}% for the same duration.

abilities.name: Bloodlust
abilities.mechanics_description: Tryndamere's Bloodlust (Q) is a self-buff that passively stores Fury and can be activated to consume Fury for bonus Attack Damage and heal him. It is an auto-target ability that is primarily used offensively to increase his damage output and defensively for sustain in fights.
abilities.original_description:
Tryndamere thrives on the thrills of combat, increasing his Attack Damage as he is more and more wounded. He can cast Bloodlust to consume his Fury and heal himself. Passive: Tryndamere thirsts for blood, gaining {{ flatad }} Attack Damage plus {{ adperonepercentmissinghp }} per 1% missing Health.

Active: Tryndamere consumes his Fury, restoring {{ baseheal }} plus {{ healperfury }} Health per Fury.

abilities.name: Undying Rage
abilities.mechanics_description: **Undying Rage (R)** is a self-buff that Tryndamere activates by casting it on himself. Upon activation, he becomes immune to all damage for a short duration and gains increased critical strike damage. This ability is purely defensive, allowing him to survive lethal damage and reposition or continue fighting during a critical moment.
abilities.original_description: Tryndamere's lust for battle becomes so strong that he is unable to die, no matter how wounded he becomes. Tryndamere becomes completely immune to death for {{ e3 }} seconds, refusing to be reduced below {{ e2 }} Health, and instantly gains <keywordMajor>{{ e1 }} Fury</keywordMajor>.

abilities.name: Spinning Slash
abilities.mechanics_description: Tryndamere's Spinning Slash is a **dash** that deals damage to all enemies in a **circular area** upon arrival. It is primarily used **offensively** to engage, deal damage, and position himself, often following up after a critical strike from his auto-attack.
abilities.original_description:
Tryndamere slices toward a target unit, dealing damage to enemies in his path. Tryndamere spins through his enemies, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage and generating {{ nonchampfurygain }} Fury per enemy hit, increased to {{ champfurygain }} Fury against enemy champions.

This Ability's Cooldown is reduced by {{ nonchampcdrefund }} second when Tryndamere critically strikes, and reduced by {{ champcdrefund }} seconds when critically striking a champion.

abilities.name: Rootcaller
abilities.mechanics_description: Rootcaller is a skillshot that Ivern throws in a target direction. If it hits an enemy, it deals damage, roots them, and creates a **second activation** that allows Ivern or an ally to dash to the rooted target's location.
abilities.original_description:
Ivern conjures a vine, dealing damage and rooting enemy targets hit. Ivern's allies can dash to the rooted target. Ivern conjures a vine dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and Rooting the first enemy hit for {{ rootduration }} seconds. Allies that Attack a Rooted enemy dash into Attack Range.

Recast: Ivern dashes directly onto the Rooted enemy.

Hitting non-epic monsters reduces Rootcaller's cooldown by 50%.

abilities.name: Friend of the Forest
abilities.mechanics_description: Ivern's passive, **Friend of the Forest**, is an **auto-target** ability used to **create groves on enemy camps**. Interacting with a grove with an attack, ability, or after a short delay allows Ivern and his allies to instantly smite the camp, granting **utility** in faster jungle clearing and sharing experience.
abilities.original_description: Ivern cannot attack or be attacked by non-epic monsters. Ivern can create magical groves on jungle camps which grow over time. When the grove is fully grown, Ivern may free the monsters to receive gold and experience.

abilities.name: Triggerseed
abilities.mechanics_description: Triggerseed is a skillshot that can be aimed in a line. Upon impact with an enemy, monster, or minion, it roots them and deals damage; if it hits a champion or monster, it also creates a second seed that can be triggered by allies to deal magic damage and dash to the target.
abilities.original_description:
Ivern places a shield on an ally which explodes after a short duration slowing and damaging enemies. The shield refreshes if it hits no enemies. Ivern grants {{ totalshield }} Shield to an ally champion or Daisy. After {{ shieldduration }} seconds, it bursts, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and Slowing enemies by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds.

If Triggerseed detonates and no enemy champions are hit while the shield still persists, the ally will be shielded for {{ totalshield }} for {{ shieldduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Brushmaker
abilities.mechanics_description: Ivern's Brushmaker is a point-and-click ability that creates a patch of brush at the target location. This is primarily a utility tool, used defensively to block enemy vision and line of sight, or offensively to set up ambushes for himself and his allies.
abilities.original_description:
In brush, Ivern and his nearby allies attacks deal bonus magic damage. Ivern can activate this ability to create a patch of brush. Passive: While in brush and for {{ buffduration }} seconds after leaving, Ivern's Attacks deal an additional {{ totaldamage }} magic damage. Nearby allies will gain this effect for {{ allybuffduration }} seconds and deal {{ totalallydamage }} magic damage.

Active: Ivern grows a patch of Brush, revealing the area for {{ revealduration }} seconds. The Brush persists until Ivern's team loses vision within it, or up to {{ maxbrushduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Daisy!
abilities.mechanics_description: **Daisy! (R):** Ivern summons Daisy, a friendly golem, at a target location. Daisy can only be directed once more after her initial summon; otherwise, she will attack the nearest enemy and move to attack any enemy that damages Ivern or his allies. Daisy applies a short stun on her third consecutive attack against an enemy, making her useful for both offensive engagement and defensive peeling.
abilities.original_description:
Ivern summons his Sentinel friend Daisy to fight with him. Re-cast command Daisy to attack or move. Ivern summons his sentinel friend Daisy to leap into the fray for {{ daisyduration }} seconds.

Daisy, Slam!: Daisy's 3rd consecutive Attack on the same champion or epic monster will launch a shockwave, dealing {{ totalshockwavedamage }} magic damage to all enemies hit as well as Knocking Up for {{ shockwaveccduration }} second. This effect can only occur once every {{ shockwavecd }} seconds.

Recast: Instruct Daisy to Attack or move.

abilities.name: Arcanopulse
abilities.mechanics_description: Arcanopulse is a linear skillshot that deals magic damage to enemies in a line, originating from Xerath. It's primarily used offensively to poke enemies at range, clear waves, and set up further offensive plays.
abilities.original_description:
Fires a long-range beam of energy, dealing magic damage to all targets hit. Begin Charging: Xerath begins charging an arcane beam, Slowing himself gradually up to 50%.

Release: Xerath fires the beam, dealing {{ tooltiptotaldamage }} magic damage. The range increases with time charged.

abilities.name: Mana Surge
abilities.mechanics_description: **Mana Surge (Passive):** When Xerath casts a spell near an **Arcanopulse** relic, he restores a portion of his mana and gains a small shield. This is an auto-targeting passive that triggers automatically when positioned correctly, and is used both defensively for sustain and survivability, and offensively by enabling more frequent spell casts.
abilities.original_description: Xerath's basic attacks periodically restore Mana. Whenever Xerath kills a unit, this cooldown is reduced.

abilities.name: Shocking Orb
abilities.mechanics_description: Shocking Orb (E) is a linear skillshot that travels a moderate distance. If it hits an enemy champion, it stuns them and deals magic damage, making it a crucial tool for Xerath's crowd control and engage.
abilities.original_description: Deals magic damage to an enemy and stuns them. Xerath fires an orb of raw magic, <status>Stunning</status> the first enemy hit for up to {{ maxstunduration }} seconds based on distance travelled, and dealing <magicDamage>{{ tooltiptotaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Eye of Destruction
abilities.mechanics_description: **Eye of Destruction (W):** Xerath fires a skillshot that deals magic damage in a line and cripples enemies hit, slowing their movement speed for a short duration. It's primarily used offensively to poke, trade, and set up for further engagement due to its slowing crowd control.
abilities.original_description: Calls down a barrage of arcane energy, slowing and dealing magic damage to all enemies in an area. Targets in the middle receive additional damage and a stronger slow. Xerath calls down a blast of arcane energy, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds. Enemies in the center take <magicDamage>{{ sweetspottotaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> instead and are <status>Slowed</status> by {{ sweetspotslowamount*100 }}%, decaying over {{ slowduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Rite of the Arcane
abilities.mechanics_description: Rite of the Arcane is a **linear skillshot** used offensively to deal high burst damage in a targeted area. Xerath channels briefly before firing three consecutive bolts of arcane energy, each with a distinct targeting path, that explode on impact for significant magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Xerath immobilizes himself and gains numerous long-range barrages. Xerath ascends to his true form and channels for {{ e1 }} seconds. During this time he may Recast up to {{ e2 }} times.

Recast: Xerath launches a magical artillery, dealing {{ tooltiptotaldamage }} magic damage. For each champion hit, the artillery deals an additional {{ rampdamagecalc }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Damnation
abilities.mechanics_description: **Damnation (Passive)** allows Thresh to collect souls that periodically drop from nearby dying enemies. These souls grant him bonus Armor and Ability Power, making him tankier and more damaging as the game progresses.
abilities.original_description: Thresh can harvest the souls of enemies that die near him, permanently granting him Armor and Ability Power.

abilities.name: Death Sentence
abilities.mechanics_description: **Death Sentence (Q)** is a linear skillshot where Thresh throws his lantern, pulling the first enemy struck. If it hits, Thresh can reactivate the ability to dash to the target, dealing magic damage and applying a short stun.
abilities.original_description:
Thresh binds an enemy in chains and pulls them toward him. Activating this ability a second time pulls Thresh to the enemy. Thresh throws out his scythe, Stunning the first unit hit and Pulling them towards Thresh for {{ tauntlength }} seconds. The scythe does {{ totaldamage }} magic damage and also grants True Sight for the duration.

Thresh can Recast this Ability to pull himself to the enemy.

If this Ability hits, its Cooldown is reduced by {{ hitbonuscooldown }} seconds.

abilities.name: Dark Passage
abilities.mechanics_description: **Dark Passage (W)** is a **skillshot** that Thresh throws a lantern forward. Allied champions can then **right-click the lantern** to teleport to Thresh's location, gaining a brief shield upon arrival.
abilities.original_description:
Thresh throws out a lantern that shields nearby allied Champions from damage. Allies can click the lantern to dash to Thresh. Thresh throws his lantern, allowing an ally to click on it to dash to Thresh.

The lantern also grants {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ shieldduration }} seconds to Thresh and the first ally champion to come in contact with it.

abilities.name: Flay
abilities.mechanics_description: Thresh's Flay is a **skillshot** that he **sweeps in a semi-circle** in front of him. If an enemy champion is hit, it **deals magic damage** and **knocks them back** a short distance, **slowing** them afterwards.
abilities.original_description:
Thresh's attacks wind up, dealing more damage the longer he waits between attacks. When activated, Thresh sweeps his chain, knocking all enemies hit in the direction of the blow. Passive: Thresh's Attacks deal additional damage based on how long since he last Attacked. They deal between {{ pattackdamagemin }} and {{ pattackdamagemax }} magic damage.

Active: Thresh whips his chains, Pulling or Pushing enemies in the direction of the swing. Enemies hit are also Slowed by {{ e2 }}% for {{ e4 }} second and take {{ totaldamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: The Box
abilities.mechanics_description: Thresh throws a spectral lantern that, after a short delay, creates a **circular box** of walls around the target location. Enemies who walk through the walls take magic damage and are **rooted** for a duration, while his allies can click on the shattered walls to **dash** to Thresh's location.
abilities.original_description: A prison of walls that slow and deal damage if broken. Thresh creates a prison of spectral walls, <status>Slowing</status> champions by {{ e3 }}% for {{ e2 }} seconds and dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. Walls break after one collision, and after one is broken, the rest deal no damage and <status>Slow</status> for half duration.

abilities.name: Blade's End
abilities.mechanics_description: **Blade's End (Passive):** Talon's auto-attacks and abilities apply bleed stacks to enemies. Once an enemy has three stacks, Talon's *next* melee auto-attack against them consumes the stacks to deal significant bonus physical damage. This passive is the core of Talon's burst damage combo.
abilities.original_description: Talon's spells Wound champions and large monsters, stacking up to 3 times. When Talon attacks a champion with 3 stacks of Wound, they bleed for heavy damage over time.

abilities.name: Noxian Diplomacy
abilities.mechanics_description: Talon's Q, Noxian Diplomacy, is a point-and-click melee attack that deals physical damage. If Talon attacks an enemy champion from behind (out of their facing direction), it critically strikes for greatly increased damage and refreshes the cooldown for a short duration. This ability is primarily used offensively for burst damage and trading, making it key to Talon's assassination potential.
abilities.original_description:
Talon stabs the target unit. If they are within melee range, this attack deals critical damage. If they are outside melee range, Talon will leap at his target before stabbing them. Talon refunds some health and cooldown if this ability kills the target. Talon leaps to a target and deals {{ leapdamage }} physical damage. If used in melee range, this Ability instead critically strikes for {{ criticaldamage }} physical damage.

If this Ability kills the target, Talon restores {{ totalhealing }} Health and refunds {{ cooldownrefund*100 }}% of its Cooldown.

abilities.name: Rake
abilities.mechanics_description: Talon's Rake is a **linear skillshot** that sends out three blades in a cone in front of him. Enemies hit by any of the blades take damage, and if an enemy is hit by **all three blades**, they are **slowed**. This ability is primarily used offensively to deal damage and apply a significant slow for follow-up attacks or escapes.
abilities.original_description: Talon sends out a volley of daggers that then return back to him, dealing physical damage every time it passes through an enemy. The returning blades deal bonus damage and slow units hit. Talon tosses a volley of blades, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totalinitialdamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>. The blades then return to him, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totalreturndamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> and <status>Slowing</status> by {{ movespeedslow*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} second.

abilities.name: Assassin's Path
abilities.mechanics_description: Assassin's Path is a skillshot that Talon throws at a target location, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit. Upon reaching its destination, Talon can **re-activate** the ability to **dash** to a new location within a short radius, allowing for aggressive engages, follow-up damage, or escape.
abilities.original_description: Talon vaults over any terrain or structure, up to a max distance. This ability has a low cooldown, but puts the used terrain on a long cooldown. Talon vaults over the nearest terrain or structure. Talon cannot dash over the same terrain more than once every {{ wallcd }} seconds.

abilities.name: Shadow Assault
abilities.mechanics_description: Shadow Assault is a circular skillshot that Talon throws at a target location, dealing damage to all enemies hit. After a short delay, Talon blinks to the edge of the circle and becomes invisible for a short duration, able to re-cast the ability to blink back to his original location. This ability is primarily used offensively for burst damage and a brief moment of invulnerability, allowing for aggressive engagements or quick escapes.
abilities.original_description:
Talon disperses a ring of blades and becomes Invisible while gaining additional Move Speed. When Talon emerges from Invisibility, the blades converge on his location. Each time the blades move, Shadow Assault deals physical damage to enemies hit by at least one blade. Talon disperses a ring of blades that deal {{ damage }} physical damage, gains {{ movespeed*100 }}% Move Speed, and becomes Invisible for {{ duration }} seconds. When the Invisibility ends, the blades return to Talon, dealing {{ damage }} physical damage again.

If Talon cancels the Invisibility with an Attack or with Noxian Diplomacy, the blades return to the target instead.

abilities.name: Arcane Mastery
abilities.mechanics_description: Ryze's passive, Arcane Mastery, is an **auto-target** ability that enhances his spellcasting. It **stores runes** from his abilities that can empower subsequent spells, granting him bonus magic damage and movement speed, or a shield when he casts a certain number of spells in rapid succession.
abilities.original_description: <mainText>Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.</mainText>

abilities.name: Overload
abilities.mechanics_description: Overload is a linear skillshot that Ryze launches in a target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit. It is primarily used offensively for damage and wave clear, but also applies a passive buff that empowers Ryze's other abilities.
abilities.original_description:
Passively, Ryze's other basic abilities reset the cooldown of Overload and charge a rune. When Ryze casts Overload with 2 runes charged, he gains a brief burst of Move Speed.

On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If the target has Flux on it, Overload deals extra damage and bounces to nearby enemies with Flux. Passive: Rune Prison and Spell Flux refresh this Ability's Cooldown and charge a rune for {{ runeduration }} seconds (max {{ maximumrunes }} runes).

Active: Ryze unleashes a blast, dealing {{ qdamagecalc }} magic damage to the first enemy hit. If the target has Flux on it, it is consumed, causing this Ability to deal {{ spell.ryzer:overloaddamagebonus }}% increased damage and bounces to nearby enemies with Flux.

Ryze also discharges all runes, granting Ryze {{ movementspeedamount }}% Move Speed for {{ movementspeedduration }} seconds if {{ maximumrunes }} runes were charged.

abilities.name: Spell Flux
abilities.mechanics_description: Spell Flux is a skillshot that Ryze fires in a target direction. Upon hitting an enemy, it deals damage and applies a mark; subsequent casts hitting marked enemies deal reduced damage and spread the mark, making it primarily an offensive tool for damaging and bursting down targets.
abilities.original_description: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs all nearby enemies. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy. Ryze fires an orb, dealing <magicDamage>{{ edamagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> and applies <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor> for {{ debuffduration }} seconds to the target and nearby enemies. Enemies already afflicted with <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor> will cause it to spread further.

abilities.name: Realm Warp
abilities.mechanics_description: Realm Warp is a targeted ability that Ryze places at a target location within a range, creating a portal that he and allied champions can enter. After a short delay, Ryze and any nearby allies who enter the portal are teleported to the chosen destination, making it a strategic tool for repositioning allies and engaging or disengaging fights.
abilities.original_description:
Passively, Overload deals even more damage against targets with Flux.

On cast, Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location. Passive: Overload damage bonus against targets with Flux increased to {{ overloaddamagebonus }}%.

Active: Ryze opens a portal to another location. After {{ chargetimetooltip }} seconds, all allies near the portal are teleported to that location.

abilities.name: Rune Prison
abilities.mechanics_description: Rune Prison is a skillshot that Ryze hurls in a target direction, dealing magic damage and rooting the first enemy hit. It's primarily used offensively to lock down a target for follow-up spells or to catch fleeing enemies, but can also provide a brief moment of crowd control in defensive situations.
abilities.original_description: Ryze traps a target in a cage of runes, damaging them and slowing their movement. If the target has Flux on it, they are instead rooted. Ryze deals <magicDamage>{{ wdamagecalc }} magic damage</magicDamage> and <status>Slows</status> by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ ccduration }} seconds. If the target has <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor>, it is consumed and this Ability <status>Roots</status> instead of <status>Slowing</status>.

abilities.name: Glorious Evolution
abilities.mechanics_description: Viktor's passive, "Glorious Evolution," is an auto-target ability. It grants him permanent augmentations to his abilities, enhancing their offensive and utility aspects as the game progresses.
abilities.original_description: Viktor gains Hex Fragments whenever he kills an enemy. With every 100 Hex Fragments he obtains, Viktor permanently augments an active ability. After upgrading all of his basic abilities, he can gather 100 Hex Fragments to augment his ultimate ability.

abilities.name: Gravity Field
abilities.mechanics_description: Gravity Field is a circular skillshot that deploys a stationary zone after a brief delay. Enemies within the field are initially slowed, and will walk towards the center of the field, becoming stunned if they reach it.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor conjures a heavy gravitational field that slows enemies caught within its radius. Enemies who stay in the field for too long become stunned.

Augment: Viktor's spells apply a slow to enemies.
Viktor deploys a gravitational imprisonment device for {{ fieldduration }} seconds, Slowing enemies inside it by {{ slowpotency*-1 }}%. Enemies who remain within its radius for 1.25 seconds are Stunned for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

Upgraded Passive: Viktor's Abilities Slow by {{ augmentslow }}% for 1 second.

abilities.name: Siphon Power
abilities.mechanics_description: Viktor's Siphon Power (Q) is a **linear skillshot** that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and grants Viktor a **temporary shield** and a **speed burst** upon impact. This ability is primarily used **offensively** for trading and poking, but its defensive augmentation makes it valuable for survivability during engagements or escapes.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor blasts an enemy unit with magic damage, which grants him a shield and empowers his next basic attack.

Augment: Siphon Power's shield is increased by 60% and Viktor gains bonus move speed after casting the Ability.
Viktor blasts an enemy, dealing {{ totalmissiledamage }} magic damage and granting Viktor {{ shieldlevelscaling }} Shield for {{ buffduration }} seconds.

Viktor's next Attack within 4 seconds deals {{ attacktotaldmg }} magic damage.

Upgraded: Grants {{ totalaugmentedshieldvalue }} Shield and Viktor additionally gains {{ augmentmovespeedbonus }}% Move Speed for {{ buffduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Arcane Storm
abilities.mechanics_description: Viktor's ultimate, **Arcane Storm**, is a circular, cast-delay skillshot that homes in on enemies within the area. It unleashes multiple lightning bolts that damage and slow enemies, making it primarily an offensive tool for burst damage and area control.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor conjures an Arcane Storm on the field, dealing magic damage and interrupting enemy channels. The storm periodically does magic damage to all nearby enemies and can be redirected by Viktor.

Augment: The Arcane Storm moves 25% faster, and whenever champions die after taking damage from it, the storm grows and increases in its duration.

Viktor conjures an Arcane Storm in an area for {{ stormduration }} seconds, which instantly deals {{ initialburstdamage }} magic damage followed by {{ subsequentburstdamage }} magic damage per second to surrounding enemies. The storm automatically follows champions it has recently damaged.

Recast: Viktor can manually move the storm.

Upgraded: The storm moves {{ augmentboost*100 }}% faster. If a champion that the storm has damaged dies, the storm increases its size and its duration by {{ tooltip_durationextension }} seconds (up to {{ maxgrowths }} times).

abilities.name: Hextech Ray
abilities.mechanics_description: Hextech Ray is a linear skillshot that Viktor fires forward, damaging the first enemy hit. It's primarily used offensively for poking and wave clear, but can also be used defensively to deter dives or create space.
abilities.original_description:
Viktor uses his biomechanical arm to fire a Hextech Ray that cuts across the field in a line, dealing damage to all enemies in its path.

Augment: An explosion follows in the Hextech Ray's wake, dealing magic damage.
Viktor fires a hextech ray in a chosen direction, dealing {{ laserdamage }} magic damage to any enemies it hits.

Upgraded: An aftershock follows Hextech Ray, dealing {{ aftershockdamage }} magic damage.

abilities.name: Vow of the First Lands
abilities.mechanics_description: Vow of the First Lands is a passive ability for Yunara that automatically marks enemy champions she hits with her abilities. These marks detonate when she lands another damaging ability on a marked target, dealing bonus magic damage, providing a defensive shield for both herself and nearby allies.
abilities.original_description: Yunara's Critical Strikes deal bonus magic damage.

abilities.name: Cultivation of Spirit
abilities.mechanics_description: Yunara channels and then unleashes a wave of spirit energy in a **linear skillshot** that **damages** enemies it passes through. This skill is primarily used **offensively** to deal damage and poke opponents.
abilities.original_description:
Yunara gains Attack Speed, bonus damage On-Hit, and her Attacks spread to nearby enemies. Passive: Yunara deal {{ calc_passive_damage }} magic damage %i:OnHit% On-Hit and attacking grants {{ resource_nonchampion }} Unleash ({{ resource_champion }} Unleash for champions).

Active: Yunara consumes {{ resource_max }} Unleash and for {{ buff_duration }} seconds gains {{ calc_attack_speed }} Attack Speed and deals an additional {{ calc_damage }} magic damage %i:OnHit% On-Hit. During this time, her Attacks spread to nearby enemies dealing them {{ calc_damage_spread }} physical damage.

Transcendent State: This Ability is instantly activated for {{ spell.yunarar:buff_duration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Arc of Judgment | Arc of Ruin
abilities.mechanics_description: Arc of Judgment/Ruin is a linear skillshot that Yunara fires in a direction. Enemies hit take damage and are briefly slowed, making it a tool for both offensive poke and catching targets.
abilities.original_description:
Yunara fires a spinning prayer bead that deals damage and slows enemies. While in her Transcendent State she instead fires off a laser that deals damage and slows enemies. Yunara lets rip a prayer bead that deals {{ calc_damage_initial }} magic damage and Slows by {{ calc_slow }} decaying over {{ slow_duration }} seconds. It deals an additional {{ calc_damage_per_second }} magic damage per second.

Transcendent State - Arc of Ruin: Yunara fires a laser that deals {{ spell.yunarar:calc_rw_damage }} magic damage and Slows by {{ spell.yunarar:calc_rw_slow_amount }} decaying over {{ spell.yunarar:rw_slow_duration }} second.

abilities.name: Kanmei's Steps | Untouchable Shadow
abilities.mechanics_description: Kanmei's Steps is a **linear skillshot** projectile that deals damage and applies a debuff.  Upon hitting an enemy champion, it **slows** them and **marks them**, allowing Yunara to **recast** the ability within a short window for increased damage.
abilities.original_description:
Yunara gains decaying Move Speed and becomes Ghosted. While in her Transcendent State she instead dashes in a direction. Yunara gains {{ calc_move_speed }} Move Speed, increased to {{ calc_move_speed_enhanced }} Move Speed when moving toward an enemy champion, that decays over {{ buff_duration }} seconds.

Transcendent State - Untouchable Shadow: Yunara dashes in a direction.

abilities.name: Transcend One's Self
abilities.mechanics_description: Yunara's ultimate, "Transcend One's Self" (R), is a self-centered, circular area-of-effect ability that she activates. Upon activation, it deals damage and applies a debuff to enemies within the radius, followed by a powerful, short-duration personal buff for Yunara.
abilities.original_description: Yunara enters a Transcendent State that upgrades her basic Abilities. Yunara enters a <keywordMajor>Transcendent State</keywordMajor> for {{ buff_duration }} seconds upgrading her basic Abilities for the duration.

abilities.name: Lunge
abilities.mechanics_description: Fiora's Lunge (Q) is a short-range skillshot dash that allows her to instantly strike a target, dealing physical damage. It can be used offensively for damage and dueling, or defensively to reposition and kite enemies.
abilities.original_description:
Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs a nearby enemy, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit effects. Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs the closest enemy, ward, or structure, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage. The strike will prioritize Vitals and enemies it will kill.

If Fiora strikes an enemy, this Ability's Cooldown is reduced by {{ cdrefundpercent*100 }}%.

abilities.name: Duelist's Dance
abilities.mechanics_description: Duelist's Dance is a passive ability that Fiora's auto-attacks and abilities hit an enemy's **Vitals**, which are glowing weak points appearing on champions. Hitting a Vital deals bonus true damage, restores health, and grants Fiora a short burst of increased movement speed, encouraging aggressive trades and repositioning.
abilities.original_description: Fiora has revealed a <keywordMajor>Vital</keywordMajor> on this Champion. If she hits the <keywordMajor>Vital</keywordMajor>, she <healing>restores Health</healing> and gains <speed>Move Speed</speed>.

abilities.name: Riposte
abilities.mechanics_description: Riposte is a **skillshot** that Fiora casts in a target direction. If Fiora is attacked during the cast time, she will **parry** the next incoming disable or damage, becoming **untargetable** and instantly **counter-attacking** the attacker for magical damage.
abilities.original_description: Fiora parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, then stabs in a direction. This stab slows the first enemy champion hit, or stuns them if Fiora blocked an immobilizing effect with this ability. Fiora parries all incoming damage, disables, and negative effects for {{ parryduration }} seconds, then stabs. The stab deals <magicDamage>{{ stabdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> to the first champion hit and <status>Slows</status> <speed>Move Speed</speed> by {{ msslowpercent*-100 }}%<attackSpeed> and Attack Speed by {{ attackslowpercent*-100 }}% </attackSpeed> for {{ ccduration }} seconds. If Fiora parries an <status>Immobilizing</status> effect, the stabbed enemy is <status>Stunned</status> rather than <status>Slowed</status>.

abilities.name: Bladework
abilities.mechanics_description: Fiora's Bladework (E) is a **dash** followed by an **attack reset**. It is used **offensively** for increased damage output and mobility, allowing her to quickly reposition and deliver a swift, empowered second strike.
abilities.original_description: Fiora has increased attack speed for the next two attacks. The first attack slows the target, and the second attack will critically strike. Fiora gains <attackSpeed>{{ aspercent*100 }}% Attack Speed</attackSpeed> for her next two Attacks. The first Attack <status>Slows</status> by {{ slowpercent*-100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} second. The second Attack always critically strikes for <physicalDamage>{{ attacktwopercenttad*100 }}% damage</physicalDamage>.

abilities.name: Grand Challenge
abilities.mechanics_description: Fiora's Grand Challenge is a point-and-click ultimate that marks an enemy champion with a Vulnerable point. She must then strike the marked Vitals that appear on the target to deal significant true damage, briefly gaining movement speed and a shield for each Vital struck.
abilities.original_description:
Fiora reveals all four Vitals on an enemy champion and gains Move Speed while near them. If Fiora hits all four Vitals or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed over the next few seconds. Passive: Duelist's Dance Move Speed bonus is increased to {{ percentms*100 }}%.

Active: Fiora reveals all four Vitals on a champion for a max of {{ spell.fiorapassive:rdamagetotal }} max Health true damage and gains Duelist's Dance's Move Speed bonus while near the target.

If Fiora strikes all four Vitals within {{ markduration }} seconds or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora restores {{ healpersecondcalc }} Health per second to surrounding allied champions for {{ healduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Conquering Sands
abilities.mechanics_description: Conquering Sands is a **linear skillshot** that deals damage to enemies it passes through. It can be used offensively to damage and last-hit, or defensively, as it generates a Sand Soldier at the target location that can be utilized by other abilities.
abilities.original_description: Azir sends all Sand Soldiers towards a location. Sand Soldiers deal magic damage to enemies they pass through and apply a slow for 1 second. Azir orders all <keywordMajor>Sand Soldiers</keywordMajor> to an area, dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage> to enemies they pass through and <status>Slowing</status> them by {{ e2 }}% for 1 second.

abilities.name: Shurima's Legacy
abilities.mechanics_description: Shurima's Legacy is an auto-target passive that enhances Azir's attack range and allows him to command his Sand Soldiers to attack enemies, providing both offensive damage and zoning control. Azir can utilize this to extend his threat range, poke from safety, and apply pressure during lane phase and teamfights.
abilities.original_description: Azir can summon the Disc of the Sun from the ruins of allied or enemy turrets.

abilities.name: Arise!
abilities.mechanics_description: Azir summons a **Sand Soldier** at a target location, which acts as a turret for a duration or until destroyed. Enemies within its area are **damaged** and **slowed**. Azir can command his Sand Soldiers to attack targets within their range by right-clicking them.
abilities.original_description:
Azir summons a Sand Soldier to attack nearby targets for him, replacing his basic attack against targets within the soldier's range. Their attacks deal magic damage to enemies in a line. Azir summons a Sand Soldier for {{ e1 }} seconds. When Azir Attacks an enemy near a Sand Soldier, he instead orders the soldiers to stab, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage in their direction.

This Ability has {{ maxammo }} charges.

abilities.name: Shifting Sands
abilities.mechanics_description: Azir commands a Sand Soldier to dash forward in a straight line, damaging and knocking aside the first enemy champion it hits. This ability is primarily used offensively to engage, deal damage, and disrupt enemy positioning, but can also be used defensively to escape by knocking aside pursuers.
abilities.original_description:
Azir shields himself briefly and dashes to one of his Sand Soldiers, damaging enemies. If he hits an enemy champion, he instantly readies a new Sand Soldier for deployment and halts his dash. Azir grants himself {{ totalshield }} Shield for {{ e6 }} seconds and dashes to one of his Sand Soldiers, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to enemies he passes through.

If Azir hits an enemy champion, he stops and gains a Sand Soldier charge.

abilities.name: Emperor's Divide
abilities.mechanics_description: Emperor's Divide is a **linear skillshot** that Azir casts a significant distance away from himself, creating a wall of soldiers that lingers and damages enemies who cross it. It's primarily used for **zoning and disengaging**, acting as a formidable defensive tool to block off pathways or peel for Azir and his team.
abilities.original_description: Azir summons a wall of soldiers which charge forward, knocking back and damaging enemies. Azir summons a wall of armored soldiers that charges forward, <status>Knocking Back</status> enemies and dealing <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. The soldiers remain, blocking enemy paths for {{ e4 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Paddle Star!
abilities.mechanics_description: Paddle Star! is a skillshot that travels a fixed distance, then can be reactivated to return to Zoe along its path. It's primarily used offensively for high burst damage, as it deals more damage on the return trip, and can be combined with her Sleepy Trouble Bubble for crowd control.
abilities.original_description:
Zoe fires a missile that she can redirect in flight. Deals more damage the longer it flies in a straight line. Zoe fires a star that deals increasing damage the further it travels to the first enemy hit and surrounding enemies -- between {{ totaldamagetooltip }} to {{ maxdamagetooltip }} magic damage.

Zoe can Recast this Ability to redirect the missile to a new position near Zoe.

abilities.name: More Sparkles!
abilities.mechanics_description: **More Sparkles! (Passive):** After casting a spell, Zoe's next attack deals bonus magic damage and can be cast from a longer range. This passive is an auto-target effect that triggers after using an ability, primarily used offensively to amplify damage during combat or poking.
abilities.original_description: Zoe's next basic attack after casting a spell deals bonus magic damage.

abilities.name: Sleepy Trouble Bubble
abilities.mechanics_description: Sleepy Trouble Bubble is a circular skillshot that travels slowly, dealing magic damage and applying a CC debuff to the first enemy hit. Enemies affected by the bubble fall asleep after a short delay, rendering them unable to act until they take damage, at which point they are dealt additional magic damage.
abilities.original_description:
Causes the target to become drowsy, then fall asleep. While asleep, the target's Magic Resist is reduced. The first source of damage that breaks the sleep is doubled, up to a cap. Zoe dropkicks a bubble that deals {{ totaldamagetooltip }} magic damage, lingering as a trap if it hits nothing. The bubble's range is extended when flying over terrain.

After a delay, the victim falls Asleep and have their Magic Resist reduced by {{ percentpen*100 }}% for 2 seconds. Attacks and Ability hits wake them up but deal double damage, up to {{ breakdamagetooltip }} true damage.

abilities.name: Portal Jump
abilities.mechanics_description: **Portal Jump (R)** is a medium-range skillshot that allows Zoe to briefly teleport to a target location, reappearing instantly after a short delay. It is primarily used for repositioning to dodge abilities, chase down enemies, or escape dangerous situations, offering significant defensive and repositioning utility.
abilities.original_description: Blink to a nearby position for 1 second. Then blink back. Zoe teleports to a nearby position for 1 second. Afterwards, she teleports back. Zoe can use Abilities and Attack, but can't move during this time.

abilities.name: Spell Thief
abilities.mechanics_description:
**Spell Thief (W) - Zoe:**

Zoe's Spell Thief is a unique auto-target ability with a delayed effect. After casting a basic ability, Zoe gains a temporary buff allowing her to cast a "stolen" basic ability from an enemy champion. This stolen ability can then be cast by Zoe as if it were her own, offering significant offensive utility for damage and burst.
abilities.original_description:
Zoe can pick up the remnants of enemy summoner spell and active item casts and cast them once herself. Whenever she casts a summoner spell, she gains 3 missiles that fire at the nearest target. Passive: Enemies drop spell shards when casting a Summoner Spell or using an Active Item. Specific minions also drop a spell shard when Zoe or a nearby ally kills them. Zoe can pick up this shard to cast that ability once.

Passive: When Zoe casts this Ability or any Summoner Spell, she gains {{ e9 }}% Move Speed for {{ e0 }} seconds and tosses 3 missiles at the target she Attacked most recently. These missiles deal {{ missiledamagetooltip }} magic damage each.

Active: Cast the Ability from a spell shard Zoe has picked up.

abilities.name: Relentless Assault
abilities.mechanics_description: Relentless Assault is Jax's passive ability. Every few auto-attacks (indicated by the counterstrike effect on his auto-attack animation), Jax's next auto-attack will strike twice, dealing bonus physical damage on the second hit. This passive empowers Jax's sustained damage output, rewarding consecutive auto-attacks with increased damage.
abilities.original_description: Jax's consecutive basic attacks continuously increase his Attack Speed.

abilities.name: Empower
abilities.mechanics_description: Jax's Empower is an auto-attack reset that deals bonus magic damage on his next basic attack. It is used offensively to extend his auto-attack combo for increased burst damage.
abilities.original_description: Jax charges his weapon with energy, causing his next attack to deal additional damage. Jax charges his weapon with energy, causing his next Attack or <spellName>Leap Strike</spellName> to deal an additional <magicDamage>{{ totaldamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Leap Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Jax's Leap Strike (Q) is a point-and-click dash that allows him to instantly warp to a target unit (enemy, allied minion, or ward) and deal magic damage. It is primarily used offensively to engage, chase enemies, or reposition for a quick burst of damage.
abilities.original_description: Jax leaps toward a unit. If they are an enemy, he strikes them with his weapon. Jax leaps to a friendly or enemy unit or ward, dealing <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage> if it is an enemy.

abilities.name: Counter Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Jax's Counter Strike is an **auto-target** ability that requires a **point-and-click** activation. Upon use, Jax enters a defensive stance, **dodging all incoming basic attacks** for a short duration before striking his next basic attack with **bonus magic damage**.
abilities.original_description:
Jax's combat prowess allows him to dodge all incoming attacks for a short duration and then quickly counterattack, stunning all surrounding enemies. Jax enters a defensive stance for up to {{ dodgeduration }} seconds, dodging incoming Attacks and taking {{ aoedamagereduction }}% less damage from area of effect Abilities. After {{ dodgeduration }} seconds or Recasting, Jax deals {{ totaldamage }} + {{ percenthealthdamage }}% max Health magic damage and Stuns nearby enemies for {{ stunduration }} second.

The damage is increased by {{ percentincreasedperdodge*100 }}% per Attack dodged, up to a maximum of {{ maxdamage }} + {{ maxpercenthealthdamage }}% max Health.

abilities.name: Grandmaster-at-Arms
abilities.mechanics_description: Jax's ultimate, **Grandmaster-at-Arms**, is an auto-target ability that he casts on himself. When activated, it grants him increased attack speed and makes his next three basic attacks deal bonus magic damage, with the third empowered attack stunning the target for an extended duration.
abilities.original_description:
Every third consecutive attack deals additional Magic Damage. Additionally, Jax can activate this ability to deal damage around himself and strengthen his resolve, increasing his Armor and Magic Resist for a short duration. Passive: Every third Attack within {{ passivefallofftime }} seconds deals an additional {{ onhitdamage }} magic damage.

Active: Jax slams his lantern down, dealing {{ swingdamagetotal }} magic damage to nearby enemies. If he hits a champion he gains {{ basearmor }} Armor and {{ basemr }} Magic Resist plus {{ bonusarmor }} Armor and {{ bonusmr }} Magic Resist per additional champion hit for {{ duration }} seconds. During this time every second Attack deals additional magic damage instead of every third.

abilities.name: Unseen Predator
abilities.mechanics_description: When Rengar is in **Brush** or using his **Ultimate**, his next **basic attack** becomes a leap that deals bonus damage. This passive is primarily used offensively to initiate combat with a burst of damage and gap close.
abilities.original_description:
While in Brush, Rengar leaps at his target with his basic attack.

Rengar generates Ferocity whenever he casts an ability. At Max Ferocity, his next ability is empowered.

Killing enemy champions awards trophies on Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace, granting bonus attack damage.

abilities.name: Savagery
abilities.mechanics_description: Savagery (Q) is a point-and-click ability Rengar uses primarily offensively for damage. It is empowered when Rengar has 3 Ferocity, allowing him to strike twice for increased damage.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar's next Attack brutally stabs his target for bonus damage.

Ferocity effect: deals increased damage and grants Attack Speed. Rengar's next 2 Attacks gain {{ e5 }}% Attack Speed. The first Attack critically strikes for {{ F4 }} (%i:scaleAD%%i:scaleCrit%) physical damage.

Max Ferocity: The first Attack critically strikes for {{ F5 }} (%i:scaleLevel%%i:scaleAD%%i:scaleCrit%) physical damage and grants Rengar {{ empoweredqas }} Attack Speed for {{ e3 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Bola Strike
abilities.mechanics_description: Bola Strike is a **skillshot** that Rengar throws in a line. Upon impact with an enemy, it deals damage and **slows** them, often used offensively for poke or to initiate a gank.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar throws a bola, slowing the first target hit for a short duration.

Ferocity effect: roots the target. Rengar throws a bola, dealing {{ totaldamage }} physical damage to the first enemy hit, revealing and Slowing them by {{ e2 }}% for {{ e3 }} seconds.

Max Ferocity: Deals {{ totalempowereddamage }} physical damage and Roots for {{ e4 }} seconds.

abilities.name: Thrill of the Hunt
abilities.mechanics_description: Thrill of the Hunt is a point-and-click activation that grants Rengar a significant movement speed and attack range bonus, allowing him to quickly close distance and engage enemies. While active, Rengar can leap a long distance onto an enemy champion, dealing bonus damage and empowering his next ability use.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar's predatory instincts take over, Camouflaging him and revealing the nearest enemy champion in a large radius around him. During Thrill of the Hunt, Rengar gains Move Speed and he can leap to the tracked enemy without being in brush, reducing their armor. Passive: Rengar will also leap Attack when Camouflaged.

Active: Rengar gains {{ stealthms }}% Move Speed and True Sight in a small area around the nearest enemy champion for {{ stealthduration }} seconds.

After {{ fadetime }} seconds, Rengar becomes Camouflaged and can leap without being in Brush. Leaping to the nearest champion deals an additional {{ bonusdamage }} physical damage, shreds {{ armorshred }} Armor for {{ armorshredduration }} seconds, and ends this Ability.

abilities.name: Battle Roar
abilities.mechanics_description: Rengar's Battle Roar is an **auto-target** ability that can be activated either at his current location or during the **dash** of his Ferocity-empowered leap. It deals damage in an area around Rengar and provides him with a **shield**, making it primarily **offensive** for burst damage and **defensive** to absorb incoming damage, especially after engaging.
abilities.original_description:
Rengar lets out a battle roar, damaging enemies and healing for some of the recent damage he has taken.

Ferocity effect: additionally breaks crowd control effects. Rengar roars, dealing {{ totaldamage }} magic damage to nearby enemies and restoring {{ damagepercentagehealed }}% of the damage taken in the last {{ e3 }} seconds as Health.

Max Ferocity: Deals {{ totaldamageempowered }} magic damage and additionally cleanses Rengar of crowd control.

abilities.name: Rock Surfing
abilities.mechanics_description: Rock Surfing is a passive ability that Taliyah gains after casting a spell. While riding her rock, she gains movement speed that increases over short distances, allowing her to kite and reposition effectively in combat.
abilities.original_description: Taliyah gains Move Speed near walls.

abilities.name: Threaded Volley
abilities.mechanics_description: Taliyah's Q, Threaded Volley, is a linear skillshot that fires a volley of stones. While the first stone deals full damage, subsequent stones deal reduced damage, encouraging players to position themselves and their targets to maximize the effectiveness of the initial hit. It is primarily used offensively for wave clear and damage.
abilities.original_description:
Taliyah throws a volley of rocks in a target direction, moving freely as she casts. This creates Worked Ground below her. If Taliyah casts Threaded Volley on Worked Ground, she consumes the ground to throw a stronger boulder that slows enemies. Taliyah hurls 5 rocks, each dealing {{ rockdamage }} magic damage in an area around the first enemy hit while creating Worked Ground at that area. Subsequent hits against the same enemy deal {{ extramissilereduceddamagepercent }}% less damage.

Casts on worked ground cost {{ e7 }} Mana and have {{ workedgroundcdr*100 }}% less Cooldown, consume the Worked Ground, and hurl a boulder that Slows enemies it hits by {{ slowpercent*100 }}% for {{ slowduration }} seconds, dealing {{ bigrockdamage }} magic damage to the primary target. Monsters hit by the boulder are Stunned for {{ monsterstunduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Seismic Shove
abilities.mechanics_description: Seismic Shove is a linear skillshot that Taliyah fires in the target direction. It deals damage and knocks enemies back, with the knockback distance increasing the further the seismic wave travels, making it useful for both engaging and peeling.
abilities.original_description: Taliyah causes an area of ground to erupt and throws enemies within it in a direction of her choosing. Taliyah quakes the earth, <status>Knocking</status> enemies in an area in the chosen direction.

abilities.name: Weaver's Wall
abilities.mechanics_description: Taliyah's Weaver's Wall is a linear skillshot that unleashes a large, impassable wall in a target direction. It is primarily used for utility, creating a zoning tool to block enemy movement, isolate targets, or peel for allies.
abilities.original_description:
Taliyah creates a very long wall and then surfs it. Taliyah creates a massive earthen wall for {{ e1 }} seconds. If she immediately Recasts, she will ride along the wall as it unravels. Moving or being immobilized will end the ride.

This ability cannot be cast if Taliyah has taken damage from Champions or structures within the last {{ damagelockouttime }} seconds.

abilities.name: Unraveled Earth
abilities.mechanics_description: Unraveled Earth is a linear skillshot that Taliyah throws forward. Upon impact with an enemy or reaching its maximum range, it erupts, dealing damage and knocking up any enemies caught in the central area.
abilities.original_description: Taliyah creates a slowing minefield. If enemies dash through it or are knocked through it, the mines explode and stun them. Taliyah scatters loose stones in an area, <status>Slowing</status> enemies hit by {{ slowpercent*100 }}% and dealing <magicDamage>{{ scatterdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>. The stones detonate when enemies dash or are <status>Knocked</status> through them, <status>Stunning</status> for the remaining movement duration + {{ stunduration }} seconds and dealing <magicDamage>{{ detonationdamage }} magic damage</magicDamage>.

abilities.name: Night Hunter
abilities.mechanics_description: Vayne's **Night Hunter (Passive)** is an **auto-target** ability. It functions as a **buff** to her movement speed when moving towards an enemy champion, allowing her to chase down targets more effectively.
abilities.original_description: Vayne ruthlessly hunts evil-doers, gaining Move Speed when moving toward nearby enemy champions.

abilities.name: Tumble
abilities.mechanics_description: Tumble is a dash that allows Vayne to reposition herself. After dashing, her next basic attack deals bonus damage, making it useful for both offensive repositioning and kiting.
abilities.original_description:
Vayne tumbles, maneuvering to carefully place her next shot. Her next attack deals bonus damage. Vayne rolls a short distance, and deals an additional {{ adratiobonus }} physical damage on her next Attack.

This Ability triggers spell effects upon dealing damage.

abilities.name: Silver Bolts
abilities.mechanics_description: Silver Bolts is a passive ability requiring no direct activation. It marks enemies hit by Vayne's basic attacks or other abilities, dealing bonus true damage on subsequent hits. This passive is used offensively to shred targets, particularly for sustained damage and bursting down enemies with its true damage component.
abilities.original_description: Vayne tips her bolts with a rare metal, toxic to evil things. The third consecutive attack or ability against the same target deals a percentage of the target's max health as bonus true damage. <spellPassive>Passive</spellPassive>: Every third consecutive Attack or Ability against an enemy deals an additional <trueDamage>{{ totaldamage }} max Health true damage</trueDamage>.

abilities.name: Condemn
abilities.mechanics_description: Condemn is a **linear skillshot** that Vayne fires in a target direction. If it hits an enemy champion, it deals damage, knocks them back a short distance, and **stuns them if they collide with terrain**, making it a potent tool for crowd control and setting up kills.
abilities.original_description: Vayne draws a heavy crossbow from her back, and fires a huge bolt at her target, knocking them back and dealing damage. If they collide with terrain, they are impaled, dealing bonus damage and stunning them. Vayne fires a bolt that <status>Knocks Back</status> and deals <physicalDamage>{{ totaldamage }} physical damage</physicalDamage>. If the target collides with terrain, they take <physicalDamage>{{ empowereddamagett }} bonus physical damage</physicalDamage> and become <status>Stunned</status> for {{ stunduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Final Hour
abilities.mechanics_description: Vayne's Final Hour (R) is an **auto-targeted** ability that she **toggles** on. It grants her increased movement speed and makes her next three attacks deal bonus true damage, making it a **powerful offensive buff**.
abilities.original_description: Readying herself for an epic confrontation, Vayne gains increased Attack Damage, Invisibility during Tumble, reduced Tumble cooldown, and more bonus Move Speed from Night Hunter Vayne gains <physicalDamage>{{ bonusattackdamage }} Attack Damage</physicalDamage> for {{ baseduration }} seconds, extended by {{ durationtoadd }} seconds whenever a champion damaged by Vayne dies within {{ damagedmarkerduration }} seconds. Additionally, during the duration:<li><spellName>Night Hunter</spellName> instead grants <speed>{{ movementspeed }} Move Speed</speed>.<li>The Cooldown of <spellName>Tumble</spellName> is reduced by {{ tumblecdreduction }}%, and grants <keywordStealth>Invisibility</keywordStealth> for {{ tumblestealthduration }} second.

abilities.name: Shepherd of Souls
abilities.mechanics_description: **Shepherd of Souls (Passive):** Yorick's basic attacks and spells apply a mark. When he has four marks on an enemy, his next ability or auto-attack on them deals bonus damage and restores health. This passive is auto-targeted through applying marks and then auto-attack/ability-triggered.
abilities.original_description: <font color='#FF9900'>The Cursed Horde:</font> Yorick can summon Mist Walkers to swarm and attack nearby enemies.

abilities.name: Dark Procession
abilities.mechanics_description: Dark Procession is a **circular skillshot** that creates a closing ring of spectral mist. Enemies caught within the initial cast range are **slowed and dealt magic damage**, and then **trapped** as the mist converges.
abilities.original_description: Yorick summons a destructible wall at target location that will block enemy movement. Yorick summons a wall of spirits blocking enemies' path, but not allies'. The wall has <healing>{{ wallhealthtooltip }} Health</healing> and disappears after {{ circleduration }} seconds.

abilities.name: Mourning Mist
abilities.mechanics_description: Yorick's E, Mourning Mist, is a **linear skillshot** that deals magic damage and **slows** enemies hit. If the mist connects with an enemy, it **applies a debuff** that causes them to take increased damage from Yorick's next three melee attacks and summons **small ghouls** to attack them.
abilities.original_description:
Yorick throws a globule of Black Mist that reduces armor, damages, slows and marks enemies. Summoned units gain move speed when moving towards marked targets. Yorick throws a globule of Black Mist that deals {{ calc_healthdamage }} max Health magic damage, Slows by {{ calc_slow }} for {{ slowduration }} seconds and marks champions and monsters for {{ markduration }} seconds. Marked enemies continuously Awaken nearby graves (but not exceeding the maximum of {{ spell.yorickpassive:yorickpassiveghoulmax }}) and suffer {{ armorshred*100 }}% reduced Armor.

Yorick and his summoned units gain {{ hasteamount*100 }}% Move Speed toward the mark. Mist Walkers will leap once at marked enemies that get away from them.

abilities.name: Last Rites
abilities.mechanics_description: Yorick's Last Rites (Q) is a point-and-click melee attack that deals damage and applies a debuff to champions or large monsters. If Last Rites kills a target, it refunds its cooldown and mana cost, encouraging aggressive trading and wave clear.
abilities.original_description:
Yorick deals bonus damage on his next attack and heals himself. If the target is a champion or large monster or if the target dies, a grave will be dug. Yorick's next Attack deals an additional {{ bonusdamage }} physical damage and restores {{ qheal }} plus {{ missinghealthratio }}% of his missing Health, reduced by {{ healreduction }}% against non-Champions. If this Attack hits a Champion or large Monster or kills the target, it leaves a grave.

When there are 3 or more graves nearby and this Ability has already been used, Yorick can Recast to raise Mist Walkers from all nearby graves.

abilities.name: Eulogy of the Isles
abilities.mechanics_description: Yorick's ultimate "Eulogy of the Isles" is a self-cast ability that creates a large, circular area around him after a short channel. Within this area, Yorick gains bonus attack speed and health regeneration, and crucially, all of his summoned Mist Walkers gain bonus armor and magic resist, making them significantly more durable and effective for sustained fights.
abilities.original_description:
Yorick summons the Maiden of the Mist that causes Yorick's attacks against the Maiden's target to deal bonus damage. The Maiden will also automatically raise Walkers from dead enemies. Yorick summons the Maiden of the Mist with {{ yorickbigghoulhealth }} Health and {{ yorickbigghouldamage }} Magic Attack Damage plus {{ rghoulnumbers }} Mist Walkers. The Maiden automatically raises Mist Walkers from nearby enemy deaths and marks enemy Champions with her attacks. When Yorick damages the Maiden's target, he deals {{ rmarkdamagepercent }}% max Health magic damage.

After 10 seconds, Yorick can Recast this Ability to free the Maiden, sending her down the nearest lane.

abilities.name: Caretaker's Shrine
abilities.mechanics_description: Caretaker's Shrine is a deployed area-of-effect ability that Bard places on the ground as a skillshot. After a short delay, it heals and grants a burst of movement speed to allies who walk over it.
abilities.original_description:
Reveals a Health shrine which powers up over a short time, disappearing after healing and speeding up the first ally that touches it. Bard creates a Health shrine that grants {{ calc_movespeed }} Move Speed decaying over {{ movespeed_duration }} seconds and restores at least {{ initialheal }} Health to the first ally to enter. The shrine grows to restore {{ maxheal }} Health after existing for {{ chargeuptime }} seconds.

Bard can have up to {{ maxpacks }} shrines at once. If an enemy champion enters a shrine, it is destroyed.

This ability has {{ ammo_limit }} charges.

Current Active Shrines: {{ f1 }} / {{ f2 }}

abilities.name: Traveler's Call
abilities.mechanics_description: Traveler's Call is an auto-target ability where, after casting a spell or attacking a target, Bard summons a spirit that travels towards him.
